title: Does the American education system need an overhaul? Who decides what our children get to learn when the world is full of so much information? - Quora
tags: Education in the United States of America

response.answer_text: The people of your own community choose what is taught in the schools. This takes the form, usually, of an elected school board that approves curricula. If you feel that something should be offered in the school system you are able to write a proposal and present it to them. They are more than likely to reject is as they have access to experts on pedagogy whom aren’t random people with unknown credentials however.

There is no American education system. Public schools are largely controlled by the 50 states - and state legislatures determine curriculum ‘guidelines’. Specific curriculum - what textbooks are used - can vary from district to district and usually is the decisions of educators. Many districts have an administrator who is the Director of Curriculum. School Boards never hear about curriculum unless a parent complains about it.
